Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition PatientSummary

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
PatientSummary 0..*BaseA - Patient Summary
header 1..1BackboneElementA.1 Report header data elements
subject 1..1SubjectA.1.1 A1.2 Patient/subject
insuranceInfo 0..1BackboneElementA.1.3 Insurance information
insuranceNumber 0..*IdentifierA.1.3.1 Insurance number
documentData 1..1BackboneElementA.1.4 Document data
created 1..1dateTimeA.1.4.1 Date created
lastUpdate 0..1dateTimeA.1.4.2 Date of last update
natureOfIPS 1..1BackboneElementA.1.4.3 Nature of the PS
participant 1..*BackboneElementA.1.5 Author and Organisation
author 1..*IdentifierA.1.5.1 Author organization
legalauthenticator 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.5.2 Legal authenticator
additionalInfo 0..*BackboneElementA.1.6 Additional information / Knowledge resources
reference 0..*Reference()A.1.6.1 External reference
relatedWith 0..*Reference()A.1.6.2 Related with
body 1..1BackboneElementA.2 Patient summary body data elements
alerts 1..1BackboneElementA.2.1 Alerts
allergy 0..*AllergyA.2.1.1 Allergy
alert 0..*BackboneElementA.2.1.2 Medical alert information (other alerts not included in allergies)
description 0..*stringA.2.1.2.1 Healthcare alert description
medicalHistory 1..1BackboneElementA.2.2 Medical history
vaccination 0..*VaccinationA.2.2.1 Vaccination/ prophylaxis information
inactiveProblem 0..*ClosedProblemA.2.2.2 Resolved, closed or inactive problems
anamnesis 0..1BackboneElementA.2.2.3 Medical history
details 0..1NarrativeA.2.2.3.1 Medical history
medicalProblems 0..1BackboneElementA.2.3 Medical problems
problems 0..1ProblemA.2.3.1 Current problems
medicalDevices 1..1BackboneElementA.2.3.2 Medical devices and implants
procedures 1..1BackboneElementA.2.3.3 Procedures
functionalStatus 0..1BackboneElementA.2.3.4 Functional status
medicationSummary 1..1BackboneElementA.2.4 Medication summary
medication 1..*MedicineA.2.4.1 Current and relevant past medicines
socialHistory 0..1BackboneElementA.2.5 Social history
observation 0..*BackboneElementA.2.5.1 Social history observations related to health
referenceRange 0..*RangeA.2.5.2 Reference date range
pregnancyHistory 0..1BackboneElementA.2.6 Pregnancy history
patientData 0..1BackboneElementA.2.7 Patient provided data
travelHistory 0..1BackboneElementA.2.7.1 Travel history
country 0..*CodeableConceptA.2.7.1.1 Country
period 0..*dateTimeA.2.7.1.2 Period
advanceDirective 0..1BackboneElementA.2.7.2 Advance Directive
documentation 0..*BackboneElementA.2.7.2.1 Documentation
results 0..1ResultA.2.8 Results
planOfCare 0..1BackboneElementA.2.9 Plan of Care
carePlan 0..*stringA.2.9.1 Plan of care

element.definition: Patient Summary. eHN guideline model.
A.1 Report header data elements

element.definition: A.1.4.1 Date created - Date on which PS was generated

A.1.4.2 Date of last update - Date on which PS was updated (date of most recent version)
Preferred system: ISO 8601

A.1.4.3 Nature of the PS - Defines the context in which it was generated. Distinguishes between three methodological approaches for generating the PS: direct human intervention by an HP, automatically generated approach and mixed approach
A.1.5 Author and Organisation

element.definition: A.1.5.1 Author organization - At least one Author and Organisation shall be listed. In the event that there is no Author, at least one Organisation shall be listed This Author should be able to provide further information on the provenance of the data present in the patient summary. Different authors contributing to individual sections and/or entries could be provided at the relevant level.
A.1.5.2 Legal authenticator - Legal entity (Health Professional or Health Care Provider) who authenticated the Patient Summary
A.1.6 Additional information / Knowledge resources -

element.definition: A.1.6.1 External reference -  A reference leading to Clinical Practice Guidelines (CPG), emergency and anesthesia guidelines or other clinical relevant guidelines. This should be used only for providing specific guidance which may not be readily available to the health professional caring for the patient.

A.1.6.2 Related with - Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which this additional information relates with, for example a link between a rare disease problem (section A.2.3.1) and guidelines for that particular rare disease (this section).

element.short: A.2 Patient summary body data elements

element.definition:
Description of medical alerts in textual format: any clinical information that is imperative to know so that the life or health of the patient does not come under threat. 
Example 1: intolerance to aspirin due to gastrointestinal bleeding. 
Example 2: intolerance to captopril because of cough (the patient is not allergic but can't tolerate it because of persistent cough)
Example 3: the patient has a rare disease that requires special treatment
Example 4: Airway Alert / Difficult Intubation
Example 5: Diagnoses such as malignant hyperthermia, porphyria, and bleeding disvaccinations; special treatments like anticoagulants or immunosuppressants; implanted devices.
Example 6: transplanted organs illustrate other information that has to be taken into  account in a healthcare contact.
Example 7: participation in a clinical trial that has to be taken into account in a healthcare contact.
A.2.2 - Medical history

element.definition: This section may provide both synthetic anamnesis (e.g. description of phases of the pathology as a chronological summary of clustered clinical information) and anecdotal evidence that clinicians can collect from the patient, and can read in a narrative form. See Section 2, Chapter III, Art 7, (c).

element.definition: Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and vaccination requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient. In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.
Patient Summary. eHN guideline model.
A.1 Report header data elements
A.1.1 Identification of the patient/subject and A.1.2 Patient/subject related contact information
A.1.3 Insurance information
Example: QQ 12 34 56 A
A.1.4 Document data
A.1.4.1 Date created - Date on which PS was generated

A.1.4.2 Date of last update - Date on which PS was updated (date of most recent version)
Preferred system: ISO 8601

A.1.4.3 Nature of the PS - Defines the context in which it was generated. Distinguishes between three methodological approaches for generating the PS: direct human intervention by an HP, automatically generated approach and mixed approach
A.1.5 Author and Organisation

A.1.5.1 Author organization - At least one Author and Organisation shall be listed. In the event that there is no Author, at least one Organisation shall be listed This Author should be able to provide further information on the provenance of the data present in the patient summary. Different authors contributing to individual sections and/or entries could be provided at the relevant level.
A.1.5.2 Legal authenticator - Legal entity (Health Professional or Health Care Provider) who authenticated the Patient Summary
A.1.6 Additional information / Knowledge resources -

A.1.6.1 External reference -  A reference leading to Clinical Practice Guidelines (CPG), emergency and anesthesia guidelines or other clinical relevant guidelines. This should be used only for providing specific guidance which may not be readily available to the health professional caring for the patient.

A.1.6.2 Related with - Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which this additional information relates with, for example a link between a rare disease problem (section A.2.3.1) and guidelines for that particular rare disease (this section).

element.short: A.2 Patient summary body data elements
element.definition: A.2 - Patient summary body data elements
A.2.1 - Alerts
A.2.1.1 - Allergy

element.short: A.2.1.2 Medical alert information (other alerts not included in allergies)
element.definition: A.2.1.2 - Medical alert information (other alerts not included in allergies)

Description of medical alerts in textual format: any clinical information that is imperative to know so that the life or health of the patient does not come under threat. 
Example 1: intolerance to aspirin due to gastrointestinal bleeding. 
Example 2: intolerance to captopril because of cough (the patient is not allergic but can't tolerate it because of persistent cough)
Example 3: the patient has a rare disease that requires special treatment
Example 4: Airway Alert / Difficult Intubation
Example 5: Diagnoses such as malignant hyperthermia, porphyria, and bleeding disvaccinations; special treatments like anticoagulants or immunosuppressants; implanted devices.
Example 6: transplanted organs illustrate other information that has to be taken into  account in a healthcare contact.
Example 7: participation in a clinical trial that has to be taken into account in a healthcare contact.
A.2.2 - Medical history
A.2.2.1 - Vaccination/ prophylaxis information

element.short: A.2.2.2 Resolved, closed or inactive problems
element.definition: A.2.2.2 - Resolved, closed or inactive problems
A.2.2.3 - Medical history

This section may provide both synthetic anamnesis (e.g. description of phases of the pathology as a chronological summary of clustered clinical information) and anecdotal evidence that clinicians can collect from the patient, and can read in a narrative form. See Section 2, Chapter III, Art 7, (c).
A.2.3 Medical problems
A.2.3.1 Current problems
A.2.3.2 - Medical devices and implants
A.2.3.3 - Procedures
A.2.3.4 - Functional status
A.2.4 - Medication summary

element.short: A.2.4.1 Current and relevant past medicines
element.definition: Relevant prescribed medicines whose period of time indicated for the treatment has not yet expired whether it has been dispensed or not, or medicines that influence current health status or are relevant to a clinical decision
A.2.5 - Social history

element.short: A.2.5.1 Social history observations related to health
element.definition: Health related lifestyle factors or lifestyle observations and social determinants of health. Example: cigarette smoker, alcohol consumption. - Preferred System: SNOMED CT GPS
Example: from 1974 to 2004
A.2.6 Pregnancy history
A.2.7 - Patient provided data
A.2.7.1 - Travel history
A.1.4.1 Country(s) visited - Preferred System: ISO 3166
A.1.4.2 Date of entry and departure - Preferred System: ISO 8601
A.2.7.2 - Advance Directive

Existence of documentation on living will.
Preferred system: SNOMED CT GPS
A.2.8 - Results
(Therapeutic recommendations that do not include pharmacologic treatments, such as diet, physical exercise, planned surgeries)

Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and vaccination requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient. In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.
